page.title: 11Old Houses in the area.
page.content: As building stone is scarce in the Greensand, it impresses one to see that the dozen old and most attractive houses edging Passfield Lane are of sandy coloured stone. Old maps show several small local quarries of the Bargate beds. The Cricketers' c1600 once the home of a blacksmith with forge next door was a pub in the last century. Quarry Cottage, stone with clay tiles, hides behind a stone wall. An old stone barn nearby was recently converted to a home and thatched. Passfield Farm dates from 1520, timber frame,still a delight.A fine old wooden framed farm house at Stand ford is the scene of much activity and close by an old dwelling 1649 has oak beams, once old naval timbers. Several grand houses of early origin lend charm to scenes along the River Wey both at Standford and Bramshott.
